Detailed Description

Provides specific methods for operations on User Table for MySQL Database.

Definition at line 37 of file MySQLTableUser.php.

Member Function Documentation

MySQLTableUser::FindUsersByName (  $  userName  ) 
 

Selects the User-s from table which TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_NAME looks like $userName.

Parameters:
$userName the name of the User to select. It can contain magic chars like MYSQL_SEEK_MULTICHARS and MYSQL_SEEK_ANYCHAR. Please refer to your database documentation.
Returns:
- a Users object : the User-s which TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_NAME looks like $userName in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableUserInterface.

MySQLTableUser::IdUserExists (  $  idUser  ) 
 

Checks whether the User of id $idUser exists or not.

Parameters:
$idUser The TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_IDUSER of the user to be checked.
Returns:
- true if user exists

- false otherwise

Implements TableUserInterface.

Returns:

MySQLTableUser::SaveUsers (  Users $  users  ) 
 

Updates validated items in $users in function of its idUser. If idUser doesn't exist, item is inserted. If an item of $users hasn't been validate, it is skipped.

Parameters:
$users a Users of items to be updated/inserted
Returns:
- NULL in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableUserInterface.

Definition at line 55 of file MySQLTableUser.php.

References IdUserExists(), InsertUser(), TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_IDUSER, and UpdateUserByIdUser().

MySQLTableUser::SelectUserByIdUser (  $  idUser  ) 
 

Selects the Site from table which TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_IDUSER equals to $idUser.

Parameters:
$idUser the id of the User to select
Returns:
- the User which TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_IDUSER equals to $idUser in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableUserInterface.

MySQLTableUser::SelectUsersByIdGroup (  $  idGroup  ) 
 

Selects the User-s from table which TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_IDGROUP equals to $idGroup. In other words : User-s that belong to the group of id $idGroup

Parameters:
$idGroup the id of the Group the User may belong
Returns:
- A Users of User-s which TableUser::TABLE_COLUMN_IDGROUP equals to $idGroup in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableUserInterface.

MySQLTableUser::UpdateUserByIdUser (  User $  updatedUser  )

Parameters:
$updatedUser The User to be updated
Returns:
